verses.kjv: He that is wounded in the stones, or hath his privy member cut off, shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD.
verses.ct: No man whose testicles have been crushed or whose male organ has been cut off may be admitted into the assembly of the LORD.

verses.kjv: A bastard shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD; even to his tenth generation shall he not enter into the congregation of the LORD.
verses.ct: No one born from an illegitimate union may be admitted into the assembly of the LORD. Even down to the 10th generation, none of his descendants may be admitted into the assembly of the LORD.

verses.kjv: An Ammonite or Moabite shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD; even to their tenth generation shall they not enter into the congregation of the LORD for ever:
verses.ct: No Ammonite or Moabite may be admitted into the assembly of the LORD. Even down to the 10th generation, none of their descendants may ever be admitted into the assembly of the LORD.

verses.kjv: Because they met you not with bread and with water in the way, when ye came forth out of Egypt; and because they hired against thee Balaam the son of Beor of Pethor of Mesopotamia, to curse thee.
verses.ct: This is because they didn't provide you with food and water along the road when you were coming out of Egypt, and because they hired Balaam son of Beor from Pethor in Mesopotamia to put a curse on you.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless the LORD thy God would not hearken unto Balaam; but the LORD thy God turned the curse into a blessing unto thee, because the LORD thy God loved thee.
verses.ct: But the LORD your God refused to listen to Balaam. Instead, the LORD your God turned the curse into a blessing for you, because the LORD your God loves you.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not seek their peace nor their prosperity all thy days for ever.
verses.ct: You must never promote their welfare or their prosperity for as long as you exist.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not abhor an Edomite; for he is thy brother: thou shalt not abhor an Egyptian; because thou wast a stranger in his land.
verses.ct: Don't despise an Edomite, because he is your relative. Don't despise an Egyptian, because you lived as an outsider in his country.

verses.kjv: The children that are begotten of them shall enter into the congregation of the LORD in their third generation.
verses.ct: The grandchildren born to them in the 3rd generation may be admitted into the assembly of the LORD.

verses.kjv: When the host goeth forth against thine enemies, then keep thee from every wicked thing.
verses.ct: When your army marches out against your enemies, stay away from everything impure.

verses.kjv: If there be among you any man, that is not clean by reason of uncleanness that chanceth him by night, then shall he go abroad out of the camp, he shall not come within the camp:
verses.ct: If any man among you becomes unclean because of something that happens during the night, he must go outside the camp. He is not allowed back inside the camp.

verses.kjv: But it shall be, when evening cometh on, he shall wash himself with water: and when the sun is down, he shall come into the camp again.
verses.ct: Then toward evening he must wash himself with water, and after the sun has set, he may return to the camp.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt have a place also without the camp, whither thou shalt go forth abroad:
verses.ct: You must designate an area outside the camp where you can go to relieve yourselves.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt have a paddle upon thy weapon; and it shall be, when thou wilt ease thyself abroad, thou shalt dig therewith, and shalt turn back and cover that which cometh from thee:
verses.ct: Keep a digging tool as part of your equipment. When you go outside to relieve yourself, dig a hole with it, and then cover up your waste before you leave.

verses.kjv: For the LORD thy God walketh in the midst of thy camp, to deliver thee, and to give up thine enemies before thee; therefore shall thy camp be holy: that he see no unclean thing in thee, and turn away from thee.
verses.ct: The LORD your God moves through the middle of your camp to protect you and to give you victory over your enemies. So your camp must be kept clean, so that he doesn't see anything offensive among you and turn away from you.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not deliver unto his master the servant which is escaped from his master unto thee:
verses.ct: You must not return a runaway slave to his master when that slave has escaped and come to you.

verses.kjv: He shall dwell with thee, even among you, in that place which he shall choose in one of thy gates, where it liketh him best: thou shalt not oppress him.
verses.ct: Let him live among you, in whatever town he chooses within your territory — wherever he prefers. You must not mistreat him.

verses.kjv: There shall be no whore of the daughters of Israel, nor a sodomite of the sons of Israel.
verses.ct: No Israelite woman or man is to become a shrine prostitute.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not bring the hire of a whore, or the price of a dog, into the house of the LORD thy God for any vow: for even both these are abomination unto the LORD thy God.
verses.ct: You must never bring the earnings of a female prostitute or a male prostitute into the house of the LORD your God to fulfill any vow, because both of these are disgusting to the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not lend upon usury to thy brother; usury of money, usury of victuals, usury of any thing that is lent upon usury:
verses.ct: You must not charge interest to a fellow Israelite — not interest on money, interest on food, or interest on anything else that is loaned.

verses.kjv: Unto a stranger thou mayest lend upon usury; but unto thy brother thou shalt not lend upon usury: that the LORD thy God may bless thee in all that thou settest thine hand to in the land whither thou goest to possess it.
verses.ct: You may charge interest to a foreigner, but not to a fellow Israelite. Follow this so that the LORD your God will bless you in everything you undertake in the land you are entering to take possession of.

verses.kjv: When thou shalt vow a vow unto the LORD thy God, thou shalt not slack to pay it: for the LORD thy God will surely require it of thee; and it would be sin in thee.
verses.ct: When you make a vow to the LORD your God, don't delay in fulfilling it, because the LORD your God will certainly hold you accountable, and failing to keep it would count as sin.

verses.kjv: But if thou shalt forbear to vow, it shall be no sin in thee.
verses.ct: However, if you choose not to make a vow at all, that is not a sin.

verses.kjv: That which is gone out of thy lips thou shalt keep and perform; even a freewill offering, according as thou hast vowed unto the LORD thy God, which thou hast promised with thy mouth.
verses.ct: Whatever you have spoken with your own mouth, you must follow through on. Any voluntary offering that you promised to the LORD your God — what you pledged with your own words — you must carry out.

verses.kjv: When thou comest into thy neighbour’s vineyard, then thou mayest eat grapes thy fill at thine own pleasure; but thou shalt not put any in thy vessel.
verses.ct: When you walk through your neighbor's vineyard, you may eat as many grapes as you want until you're satisfied, but you must not put any into a container to take with you.

verses.kjv: When thou comest into the standing corn of thy neighbour, then thou mayest pluck the ears with thine hand; but thou shalt not move a sickle unto thy neighbour’s standing corn.
verses.ct: When you walk through your neighbor's grain field, you may pick heads of grain by hand, but you must not use a sickle on your neighbor's standing grain.
